abstract: At an "Arrested Development" reunion event on Sunday, Mr. Hurwitz said he was planning 9 or 10 episodes of a television series that would reintroduce the show's characters and lead into a possible film.
snippet: At an "Arrested Development" reunion event on Sunday, Mr. Hurwitz said he was planning 9 or 10 episodes of a television series that would reintroduce the show's characters and lead into a possible film.
lead_paragraph: Captain Ahab had Moby-Dick; Linus van Pelt had the Great Pumpkin; and, in the five years since "Arrested Development" has gone off the air, fans of that underdog Fox comedy series have spent their lives pining for a film adaptation that would further the adventures of its deeply dysfunctional Bluth clan.

headline.main: 'Arrested Development' Movie, and New TV Episodes, Are in the Works
